festival.introText:
Otherlands Music & Arts Festival will take place from 11-13 August at Scone Palace, the Category A-listed historic house near the city of Perth. The three-day camping retreat of music, art and culture features the best acts in live and electronic music across five stages.

 

Hugely popular UK club/garage duo Overmono will perform live, as well as Grammy-nominated cult producer and DJ Hudson Mohawke with his only Scottish date this year.

 

Also featured on the impressive lineup are techno sensation Skin On Skin, high-energy Australian DJ HAAi, renowned Bulgarian performer KiNK [live], beloved father-daughter team Floorplan and the dynamic London-based Australian duo X CLUB.

 

Rinse FM’s Jyoty  joins the bill with her vibrant, eclectic selections, as well as award winning multi-talented DJ and producer Nia Archives, rising star Pretty Girl (live) and dance pop duo Nimmo.

 

With a genre-spanning programmes further acts confirmed include the soulful and sublime Becky Sikasa, Glaswegian post-punks VLURE, award winning breakthrough hip hop artist Bemz, Perthshire indie pop six-piece Parliamo, jazz, RnB, rock and soul quintet Grace & the Flat Boys, emerging rapper Psweatpants, alt-pop duo Love Sick and the riotous Humour.

 

They are joined by a strong cast of local Scottish electronic music talent, including Harri & Dominic, All Good, Craigie Knowes, Telford & Stevie Cox, Danse Atmos, Celeste, Calowae b2b Mirren, Dannsa, DJ Suzie, Elanda, Emjanero, Glitch 41, Inez, Kairogen, Le Freak & Friends, Polka Dot Disco Club and Voyage with further names to be announced.

 

Presented by the established Scottish promoters FLY, Otherlands will return to the stately grounds of Scone Palace in the idyllic Perthshire countryside, following on from the hugely successful debut edition last year which has already positioned the event as a key fixture of Scotland’s festival scene.

 

This year Otherlands will also be partnering with Boiler Room, promising the thrilling atmosphere that is synonymous with the popular broadcasting platform.

 

Alongside the first-class music programme, Otherlands offers an immersive festival experience with yoga and meditation sessions, comedy acts, talks from industry leaders and hands-on DJ workshops.

 

Sam Joss, Festival Director, said: “After the overwhelming success of the inaugural Otherlands Festival last year, we’re thrilled to be returning to the one-of-a kind location at Scone Palace with another sensational lineup. Otherlands is already proving to be an unmissable summer festival, attracting thousands of music lovers not only from Scotland but across the UK, and we can’t wait to welcome everyone back this year for what promises to be an even bigger and better second edition.”
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of Otherlands Music & Arts Festival 2022. Get Otherlands Music & Arts Festival tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com

reviews.title: Review of Otherlands Music & Arts Festival
reviews.body: Bit far having police dogs etc but other than that perfect

faqs.question: When is Otherlands Music & Arts Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Otherlands Music & Arts Festival takes place on Friday 11th - Sunday 13th August 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to Otherlands Music and Arts Festival by train?
faqs.answer:
Perth station is the closest rail link to the festival site. 

 

Otherlands will be operating a shuttle service between Perth bus station and the festival that will pick-up & drop-off frequently on Friday / Saturday / Sunday / Monday.

faqs.question: Camping / Boutique Camping at Otherlands Music and Arts Festival
faqs.answer:
Access to Otherlands standard campsite is included in all tickets - there is no extra charge for this.

 The campsite will open Noon Friday 19th and close Noon Monday 22nd.

Otherlands will have a campsite shop on site to stock all of your last minute camping needs.

 A small amount of alcohol will be permitted into the campsite - 8 cans or 1 bottle of wine. No spirits allowed. All glass bottles must be decanted into plastic bottles.

 Boutique camping is available as an add-on to your ticket and will be on-sale in February.

faqs.question: Accessibility at Otherlands Music & Arts Festival
faqs.answer:
Otherlands Festival is committed to being accessible. To ensure that guests with accessibility requirements are comfortable Otherlands are able to offer additional support across the campsite and arena. 

 

To discuss your needs, please contact Otherlands directly at accessibility@otherlandsfestival.com. Otherlands aim to get back to in 5-7 workings days.

 

If you require an alternative format or a phone call, email Otherlands and they can arrange this for you by email.

faqs.question: How much is a ticket to Otherlands Music & Arts Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Head to the tickets section to find out the latest ticket prices.

faqs.question: Where is Otherlands Music & Arts Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Otherlands Music & Arts Festival is located at Scone Palace, Perth PH2 6BD

faqs.question: How do I get to Otherlands Music and Arts Festival by coach?
faqs.answer:
Otherlands are working with Big Green Coach Company to operate easy & affordable buses from most Scottish cities & towns, straight to the festival gates.

 

Tickets for these services are now on-sale at https://www.otherlandsfestival.com/shop/otherlands-festival-2022

 

For customers travelling from the rest of the UK & beyond we advise travelling to Edinburgh, Glasgow or Dundee and then taking one of these buses.

faqs.question: What bookable facilities are available at Otherlands Music & Arts Festival?
faqs.answer:
Otherlands offer facilities for accessibility guests across the campsite and arena, and have detailed these below. 

 

Bookable accessible facilities:

  • A complimentary personal assistant ticket
  • A complimentary car parking space in the accessible car parking
  • A space in our accessible campsite, with access to accessible toilets, showers (limit of 6 people per group)
  • A disabled viewing platform pass (for Main Stage) and 1 for a Personal Assistant.

 

If you would like to book the above facilities, please contact accessibility@otherlandsfestival.com. For bookable facilities you will need to include supporting documents for your disability to support your request. Your documents must include your full name. Otherlands accept any of the following:

  • DLA
  • PIP
  • Blue badge parking & photo ID
  • Medical professionals letter
  • Nimbus Access card
  • D/deaf or blind registration
  • War Disablement Pension
  • Armed Forces Independence payment
  • CredAbility Access Card

 

If you do not have any of these forms of documentation and wish to discuss your needs further, please email accessibility@otherlandsfestival.com.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Campervans at Otherlands Music & Arts Festival
faqs.answer: Yes, we will have a separate campsite to allow for campervans - there will be an additional fee to access this. Showers & toilets will be provided. More info coming soon.

faqs.question: Does Otherlands Music & Arts Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes you must be 18 or over to attend Otherlands Music & Arts Festival. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: How do I get to Otherlands Music and Arts Festival by car?
faqs.answer:
There will be space for car parking and drop-off / pick-up on site, although please consider the environmental impact of this mode of transport and consider Otherlands' affordable train & bus routes instead. Book parking spaces in advance to avoid higher fees when purchasing on arrival at https://www.otherlandsfestival.com/shop/otherlands-festival-2022

Drive time:

  • Glasgow 1 hour
  • Edinburgh 1 hour
  • Dundee 30 mins
  • London 6 hours

faqs.question: What other accessible facilities are available at Otherlands Music & Arts Festival?
faqs.answer:
• 24 hour welfare and medical team available to support all customer needs.
  • Fridge available in the medical tent to keep medications cool
  • Accessible toilets across site secured with a RADAR lock
  • Lowered bars and large print menus at vendors.
  • Approved assistance dogs will be permitted into the site, provided appropriate certification from the owner. Please email us for more information. 
  • Free drinking water will be available across site from designated water points.
  • Seating is available in different areas across the site.

 

Whilst Otherlands is an open air event, it is important to note that crowds may build up in certain areas during the festival. We recognise that for those with mental health, emotional or sensory issues; the sounds, lights, smells and crowds have the potential to be overstimulating. Spaces such as Welfare, Info Point or the Accessible Campsite are available and our teams there will understand, do not hesitate to find us there.

 

Please do contact us on accessibility@otherlandsfestival.com to discuss any specific requirements.

faqs.question: Parking at Otherlands Music and Arts Festival
faqs.answer:
For those wanting to drive to the festival Otherlands will have a car park on-site.

 

We advise booking this in advance as spaces are limited and pricing is cheaper than buying on the day at https://www.otherlandsfestival.com/shop/otherlands-festival-2022

 

Final entry times:

Friday 19th 10pm

 

Saturday 20th 5pm

 

Sunday 21st 5pm

faqs.question: Site access at Otherlands Music & Arts Festival
faqs.answer:
The festival site is located in the Scone Palace Parklands, this area is largely flat with campsite and arena all on the same level. The ground is a mixture of grass and hard dirt tracks. There will be staff and signs prepared to direct you to the right place.

 

Detailed directions will be sent to all ticket holders closer to the time.

 

Accessibility parking will be next to check-in with an easy route into the festival for all accessible customers. If you are being dropped off, the accessible car park will also act as a drop off point for customers wishing to check in via accessible check-in.

 

As an open-air event it is important prepare as best you can for changes in weather conditions as this can affect the ground conditions

 

Approximate distances around site are listed below:

 

- Accessible parking > Check -in50m

- Check -in > Accessible Campsite100m

- Accessible Campsite        >Main Stage400m

- Accessible Campsite >Furthest Stage700m

 

If you require any more details please contact accessibility@otherlandsfestival.com.

faqs.question: What are the event opening/closing times at Otherlands Music & Arts Festival?
faqs.answer: TBC

faqs.question: How do I get to Otherlands Music and Arts Festival by plane?
faqs.answer:
Dundee Airport is the nearest airport to the festival site (22 miles). Logan Air operate routes between London & Belfast to Dundee and have kindly given Otherlands a 20% off discount code for all Otherlands travellers flying on these routes between Thursday 18th & Tuesday 23rd August - FLYSCONE22. The second closest airport to the site is Edinburgh Airport (44 miles).

 

Otherlands advise if flying into one of these airports to take a taxi direct to the site or to one of our bus shuttle stops.

faqs.question: Inclusivity at Otherlands Music & Arts Festival
faqs.answer: Otherlands are an independent festival committed to being accessible and inclusive. It is our first year hosting campers and recognise that we can always be working to improve our services. If you have any feedback or suggestions, please contact us on accessibility@otherlandsfestival.com.

faqs.question: Cash & card at Otherlands Music & Arts Festival
faqs.answer: Otherlands will operate a cashless site. All bars and food traders will accept contactless payments or chip and pin only.

faqs.question: What are the food options at Otherlands Music & Arts Festival?
faqs.answer: You will be allowed to bring food into the campsite, although Otherlands will have many gourmet street food options available in the main arena and in the campsite.

faqs.question: How do I get to Otherlands Music and Arts Festival by private coach?
faqs.answer:
Attendees planning to arrive via private coach (8 seats +) must complete the below form. A member of the Otherlands team will contact you with the relevant accreditation & guidance for arriving on site.

 

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe1OIBlDqV5izZxFTgF1DBCcowAjAcaEw0AU_OB92VnYBUL1g/viewform

faqs.question: What items are prohibited from Otherlands Music & Arts Festival?
faqs.answer:
The following items are prohibited from Otherlands Music & Arts Festival:

  • Aerosols over 250ml 
  • Air horns 
  • Animals (except assistance dogs) 
  • Audio visual recording equipment (Professional) 
  • BBQs 
  • Balloons 
  • Bicycles, scooters, roller skates, skateboards 
  • Blow torches
  • Cameras (Professional camera’s with removeable or fixed lenses over 4 inches) 
  • Chinese lanterns 
  • Drones 
  • Fireworks / pyrotechnics 
  • Flag with poles 
  • Flares / distress flares / smoke flares 
  • Gazebos 
  • Gas cylinders 
  • Glass 
  • High Vis Clothing 
  • Illegal substances (drugs) 
  • Laser pens 
  • Legal highs 
  • Nitrous oxide / herbal highs 
  • Megaphones 
  • Penknives 
  • Smoke bombs / canisters 
  • Sound systems (including mini-rigs, boomboxes etc.)
  • Spray cans 
  • Weapons or sharp objectives 
  • Any object that security feels could cause harm or danger to the smooth running of the event.

faqs.question: What should I wear to Otherlands Music & Arts Festival?
faqs.answer:
Due to the unpredictable nature of Scotland's weather we recommend you bring appropriate footwear such as boots or wellies and a waterproof jacket.

 

Otherlands is a place where you can be free and express yourself, so wear whatever you like.

 

However, we kindly ask that you do not wear a Native American headdress due to their protected cultural significance.
